intro: Planchonella cinerea, commonly known as the silver ash or white ash, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to the Pacific Islands, including parts of Polynesia, Micronesia, and Melanesia. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and its smooth, greyish bark. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and typically have a glossy appearance. Planchonella cinerea is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to grow in sandy or well-drained soils.
